page.title: 17Boston Stump's Caretaker
page.content: On an interview of the caretaker of {Boston Stump}I asked him what he actually did he replied that he was the Guardian of the Tower.That means he lets people up the tower.Even though he is the caretaker he visits the church everyday.The oldest thing in the Stump is the Sancutary Knocker. It's more than 900yrs old.The caretaker enjoys his job because its interesting and he meets interesting people.Americans visit mostly this is because their Boston is named after ours.It takes Â£400,000 to maintain the stump.Masons of different Guilds built it.The Cotton Chapel got its name after the priest John Cotton.The stump can hold 2000 people.It was built in 1309. The ghost of the Grey Lady is only a myth.There is no danger of the stump falling down.
